meanings.definition: A person or animal that eats seeds.
meanings.sent1: The seedeaters in the garden enjoy pecking at sunflower seeds.
meanings.sent2: Birds are common seedeaters, feeding on various seeds to survive.
meanings.sent3: The seedeaters at the bird feeder have turned into quite the seed connoisseurs.
meanings.sent4: The field was filled with seedeaters, each one a tiny gardener planting seeds with every peck.
meanings.sent5: The little seedeaters fluttered around, spreading seeds wherever they went.

meanings.sent1: The garden was visited by a flock of seedeaters, each one chirping happily.
meanings.sent2: The seedeaters gathered in the park, creating a cheerful chirping chorus.
meanings.sent3: The seedeaters decided to have a seed-eating contest to see who could eat the most in one minute.
meanings.sent4: The field was a sea of seedeaters, a colorful carpet of chirping life.
meanings.sent5: The seedeaters hopped from branch to branch, their beaks cracking open seeds with ease.
